sentences.en: Bryan remained titular head of the party.
General Li Tsung - jen was kicked upstairs and made titular head of the generalissimo's bureau Peiping.
sentences.cn: 李宗仁将军被抬得高高的,当上了有名无实的委员长北平行辕主任.

sentences.en: He is titular head, and merely signs laws occasionally.
sentences.cn: 他是名义上的首脑，不过偶尔签字批准法律法规。

sentences.en: The honorary or titular head of a university.
sentences.cn: 大学名誉校长,大学名义校长.

sentences.en: The Queen is titular head of the Church of England.
sentences.cn: 英国女王是英国国教名义上的领袖.

words.tran_cn: 有名无实的；有头衔的；标题的

trans.tran_cn: （有）称号的，（有）头衔的，名义上的，书名的
trans.tran_en: A titular job or position has a name that makes it seem important, although the person who has it is not really powerful
